abstract: Former solicitor general Paul D Clement has appeared before the Supreme Court 49 times, both for the government and against it, and is likely to appear before the court once again this time to challenge the health care reform law; Clement is admired by both his adversaries and colleagues for his impressive resume and his legal acumen, which is why he is often tapped to argue controversial cases; is widely thought of as a potential Supreme Court nominee.
snippet: Paul D. Clement, who has appeared before the Supreme Court 49 times, for the government and against, is likely to add one more case — the challenge to the health care overhaul law.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: Paul D. Clement, who has appeared before the Supreme Court 49 times, for the government and against, is likely to add one more case — the challenge to the health care overhaul law.

headline.main: Lawyer Opposing Health Law Is Familiar Face to the Justices
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Opposing Health Law Is Familiar Face to the Justices
headline.seo: Paul D. Clement’s Latest High-Profile Cases
